storyInfo: By chance, Popukar finds a hand-drawn comic book and uncovers Spot's past.

attributes.content: Spot.
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Spot, I'm here to return your comic.
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Hmm, the door's not locked... Is he... out?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: I'll put it back where it belongs!
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: O-Oh no! Did I knock the bookshelf over?!
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: I gotta pick it back up...
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Okay!
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: But all the comics are on the floor now... I don't know which one to put where... Is Spot gonna get mad?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Maybe I'll just put all the ones with the same titles in a pile together and wait till he's back.
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Huh? How come this one doesn't have a title?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Popukar finds a leather bound book that stands out from the pile of comics. There is nothing but dust on its plain cover. No title, no art, not even a single word.
Which pile should I put this in?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Popukar flips open the book. The pages have slightly yellowed. There are comics inside, but they are all clearly hand-drawn rather than printed.
Although they aren't very professional, they aren't careless doodles, either.
My knee... My leg...
attributes.name: Soldier

attributes.content: Bornu, can't you talk to your old man and get us an officer with better things to do than make us 'train' by crawling on the ground for an hour? As if that's fun?
attributes.name: Soldier

attributes.content: I tried. No dice.
attributes.name: Youth

attributes.content: This Bornu guy looks kinda like Spot!
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: I think I remember, Spot's real name is... Something... Bor...?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Bukar Bornu! Yep!
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Oh, the line pokes out of the frame here...
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: At ease—Attention!
attributes.name: Officer

attributes.content: Look at the sorry shape you're in! Slacking off. Can't even stand straight! Our brothers on the front lines are spilling blood and sweat every day. What about you?
attributes.name: Officer

attributes.content: You've even got a man reading comics—
attributes.name: Officer

attributes.content: —Brigadier General Bornu!
attributes.name: Officer

attributes.content: At ease.
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: Who's reading comics?
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: Sir! It's Bukar Bornu!
attributes.name: Officer

attributes.content: Popukar turns the page, a wide shot covers the whole thing.
Bornu the soldier's hidden comics were all piled in the middle of the barracks.
The person who drew the comics in the book very carefully drew their covers, titles, and issue numbers. The strokes are all very heavy, so much that the pages are almost torn.
The people around him are crudely drawn in only a few strokes, to the point that they seem almost unreal.
Brigade, kneel!
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: Not you, Bornu.
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: You are going to read every single word in these comic books. When you finish, that's when they can stand.
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: Brigadier General Bornu, sir. The books are mine. I should be the one to kneel...
attributes.name: Youth

attributes.content: You'd best get started, or they will be kneeling until dawn.
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: Even these books with their dreamed-up stories know that a man has to take responsibility for the mess he makes.
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: You can't even do that, and you still read those superhero stories? You want to be a hero? You?
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: By the time the young man is finished reading his books aloud, it has already been two hours.
Although some of the other soldiers sympathized with him at first, after two hours of kneeling, their eyes were filled with nothing but scorn.
Is it really so bad to read comics?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: No, Bornu's daddy—Spot's daddy's got it all wrong!
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: After that, the entire brigade was sent to the front lines.
Most believed the reason behind this decision was Bornu angering his father, and this made his situation all the worse.
In the end, Bornu chose to desert.
He was caught by the patrolmen before he could even leave the encampment. But, coincidentally, an enemy attack came at the exact same time.
The enemy's onslaught was swift and brutal. Before long, the already demoralized brigade was defeated.
There's nobody here. Let's split up and run.
attributes.name: Soldier

attributes.content: Why the face? You gonna tell me you just remembered you've got a dad who's a general?
attributes.name: Soldier

attributes.content: I hate him. He humiliated me, belittled me, and said I could never be a hero.
attributes.name: Youth

attributes.content: Then what are you waiting for?
attributes.name: Soldier

attributes.content: I don't want everything to go his way.
attributes.name: Youth

attributes.content: What, you've got a fever? Got a concussion from all the explosions?
attributes.name: Soldier

attributes.content: If I run, I'll be branded as a deserter forever. He'll never let me live it down, I'll spend the rest of my days in shame!
attributes.name: Youth

attributes.content: Yeah, and? You seriously want to be a hero? Save your own ass first!
attributes.name: Soldier

attributes.content: I know I'm no hero.
attributes.name: Youth

attributes.content: But if I die, the miserable old man is going to regret what he said. Even if he doesn't, at least he won't have anything else to complain about. And if I survive this, I'll throw back in his face everything he's ever said to humiliate me!
attributes.name: Youth

attributes.content: If you wanna run, then run. This is my problem. Family business.
attributes.name: Youth

attributes.text: The young man knows that he doesn't have what it takes to fight this enemy. All he can do is gather the scattered remnants of his brigade.
Soon, the band of remnants grows into a squad of several dozen men.
Of course, the enemy has eyes on them, but the young man persists.
When they see the shield in his hand, more and more men start to gather at his side.
By the time they evacuate to the nearest allied encampment, there are two hundred men following him.

attributes.content: Bornu, come forward!
attributes.name: Officer

attributes.content: In recognition of your contribution to the last battle, you are hereby awarded the Hero's Medal, Class II!
attributes.name: Officer

attributes.content: Now, read out your citation!
attributes.name: Officer

attributes.content: The young man takes the citation from his superior, a heavy medal on his chest.
He suppresses his surging emotions and sweeps his eyes across the crowd below, only to find his father missing.
With equal parts regret and relief, he begins to read the citation.
This medal is hereby awarded on the order of...
attributes.name: Youth

attributes.content: Brigadier General Bornu.
attributes.name: Youth

attributes.content: Bornu...?!
attributes.name: Youth

attributes.content: *sniff* *sniff*...
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: I knew it! I knew Spot and his daddy were going to make up!
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Popukar rubs her eyes and flips to the next page to find it blank.
That's it?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Popukar, what are you reading?
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Eeep!
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Sorry, Spot. I didn't mean to knock the bookshelf over...
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Eh, I know you didn't.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Wait, that thing you're reading...
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: I love this comic!
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: You drew it yourself, didn't you? I never knew you were so talented, Spot!
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: I didn—
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.text: 'I didn't draw that, and that main character isn't me.'

attributes.content: For some reason, Spot can't bring himself to finish the sentence.
Popukar, it's almost bedtime. Go find Orchid.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Yep! We have training tomorrow, and Orchid is throwing us a party afterwards!
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Oh, I forgot about that.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Spot, are you mad...?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Of course not. I don't even get mad at Midnight.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Now off you go.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Spot picks up the book and hesitates for a moment before turning around to sort through the pile of comics on the floor.

He knows his comics like the back of his hand, and just looking at the art on the back cover is enough to tell which issue of which series from which creator a book is. This will take no time to clean up.
After he puts everything back in place, Spot takes a look at the leather book again.
No, I need to tell Popukar not to let anyone know what she just saw.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Hero? I've gave up on that a long time ago.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Hey, if I can at least be a hero to Popukar... to A6...
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: No way. I don't have what it takes.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Party! Party!
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: That's right. It's a party.
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: (Sighs audibly)
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: You all did great in that second round of drills. Lucky you did, too, or I would've canceled our party.
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: Hehe, I gave it everything I had to keep Instructor Dobermann from lecturing us for an hour.
attributes.name: Catapult

attributes.content: Oh, did you now?
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: Uhh... Maybe seventy to eighty percent?
attributes.name: Catapult

attributes.content: If I may say so, all of us performed exceptionally well today.
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: Of course, if I had to name one man who gave the most exceptional performance, I reluctantly nominate myself!
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: Oh, what a cold response. I'm hurt.
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: Especially you, Spot. Do you really have no thoughts whatsoever on my perfect battle performance?
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Sorry, something on my mind. Wasn't listening.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Oh, how cruel—
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: Okay, Midnight, shut up.
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: (Shrugs elegantly)
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: Honestly, though, I think Spot did the best out of all of us today.
attributes.name: Catapult

attributes.content: Yeah!
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: He was acting kinda weird during the first drill, like he was trying to fight Instructor Dobermann. I was kinda worried...
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: But not the second one! He healed me right when I needed it, and he helped me block Instructor Dobermann!
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: That block was clutch.
attributes.name: Catapult

attributes.content: I could tell right away the angle she was attacking from was iffy, but I didn't expect Spot to basically teleport right above her.
attributes.name: Catapult

attributes.content: If he hadn't been there at that exact moment, Instructor Dobermann would've come right for me after she took down Popukar. If that happened, we would've been done for.
attributes.name: Catapult

attributes.content: Indeed!
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: Both Spot's heroic aura during the first round and his quick wits during the second round almost had me playing second fiddle—
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: Midnight, cut the bullshit.
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: Spot's... not in a good mood.
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: Popukar told you?
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: (Nods)
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: Why... Why is everyone unhappy, all of a sudden?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Spot, was I not supposed to tell anyone about the comic—
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Popukar, let's not talk about this right now, okay?
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: Ugh—
attributes.name: Catapult

attributes.content: So—
attributes.name: Catapult

attributes.content: Right, the party! Orchid, is the canteen gonna be crowded today?
attributes.name: Catapult

attributes.content: Don't worry. With our meticulous Orchid leading the way, no matter how crowded the place is, we'll definitely find seats. Isn't that right?
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: Sure...
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: Spot, don't be mad, okay...? I'm sorry...
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: I told you already. I'm not mad.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: It's just... There are some things I'm not sure I should talk about, and I haven't figured out how to talk about them.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Like—Hm...
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Midnight, say something.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Oh? My friend, you've finally turned to the deep well of knowledge that is my brain. The perfect place to seek inspiration.
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: Uh...
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Sorry, this is the first time I've ever heard a guy admit his brain's full of water.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: You see, Popukar? When I say 'I haven't figured out how to talk about this,' I mean I know how to say 'uh,' but not quite 'his brain's full of water.' Get it?
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Anyway, I'll explain everything when we get to the canteen.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: So... I didn't do anything bad?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: No, you didn't.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: So, can I tell everyone what happened to you?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Popukar...
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: It's alright. Go ahead. If you do it, that's less I have to explain myself.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Wha?
attributes.name: Catapult

attributes.content: Wow, Spot, I had no idea you were so badass!
attributes.name: Catapult

attributes.content: Your brigade was routed, and you still gathered two hundred men in the aftermath?
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: As much as it pains me to admit it, that is an achievement even I owe a standing ovation.
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: But why did you get so gloomy when someone learned what you did? If I were you, I would be shouting my heroic deeds from the rooftops, to everyone far and wide, showing my medal to anyone who would look.
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: I didn't get a medal.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: He didn't pin one on you? What an oversight—
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: Because...
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Spot picks up a dinner roll and takes a bite.
He figures that if he bites down hard, he'll gain the courage he needs here.
But he doesn't do it.
His jaws exert just as much force as usual. From chewing to swallowing, everything goes as smooth as could be.
Because I never gathered up any routed men.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: That night, when the enemy came, it didn't take long before I was alone.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: I took my chance and slipped out of their encirclement, and then...
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Spot pauses for a moment to take a sip of juice, almost like it's intentional.
He's worried he might choke, but his mind is too occupied.
He once assumed he would keep this secret forever.
But, at this very moment, he realizes it would be more difficult to hide it from his friends, with whom he spends so much time.
There was no going against my gut feeling, no gathering the remaining forces, and no award ceremony.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: I ran away. That's it.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: The whole damned army hated me. They expected me to run. And it's basically my personality. I was performing my strategic function.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: If I was gonna play hero, it would've spoiled the whole plot.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Spot, you don't have to talk about yourself like that.
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: Whatever.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: What of it, Orchid? You're thinking I didn't want Popukar to tell you guys because heroics like that aren't my style, right?
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Yeah... pretty much.
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: A moment of silence passes.
Moments of silence like this are rare for Team A6.
Spots takes a look around.
Popukar seems a bit dejected; Midnight appears frivolous as ever; Orchid looks a bit tense, stirring her coffee repeatedly with a spoon; and Catapult sits restlessly as ever.
The one and only thing that's common to all of them is that they genuinely care about him.
So... you drew the comic Popukar was talking about?
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: That brigade was stupid. I listened to my old man and went out there to suffer. I had just about as much water in my brain as Midnight does now.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: The officers never saw footsoldiers as human. Every month, someone would collapse from overtraining, and in the end, we'd be shedding our blood in the pointless squabbles of the lords ameer.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: The hot climate was probably the only good thing about those years. The heat dried up all the water in my brain, and finally gave me a clear enough head to realize I should just desert.
attributes.name: Spot
Spot
attributes.content: But...

attributes.name: Spot
attributes.content: What if I didn't?
For a long time, I couldn't shake the thought. And that's what gave birth to the self-glorifying doodle Popukar found.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: I drew it, even fantasizing like an idiot that if I didn't desert, my old man would've come around to see me in a new light.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Spot, let me go right to the point here. As well as I know you, I can say this: that's impossible.
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: Midnight!
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: It's fine. Let him talk.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Many moons ago, when I still dominated my line of work as the Devil of the Eastern Night, I once had an industrious coworker. He was known far and wide for his incisive way with words.
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: We've barely gotten started, and I've already got a bad feeling about this.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: If you're gonna tell me your buddy joined the Higashinese military for some reason and couldn't fit in, well, I'm gonna be disappointed.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: (Laughs)
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: *sigh*.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: I can see right through your phony stories, but at least your heart's in the right place.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: If you end up being some great hero, I'll probably lose faith in the collective sanity of mankind.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: But if everybody comes to see me as a hero, I think I'll probably assume the species is just stupid.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: At the end of the day, my family raised me on an ideal that I just can't fit.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: That's why the comic ends with me getting a medal. It's the best my lousy imagination can conjure up anyway.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Even if I kept it going, once Bornu became a hero, I wouldn't know how to keep his heroics up. I can't plan it out, especially when it's an idea born out of a contradiction to begin with.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: I think... I don't get it anymore... kinda...
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: It's okay. It'll make sense after you grow up.
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: But did I do something bad? Is that why you had to talk about stuff you don't want to talk about?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: No way.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Actually, it's all thanks to you, Popukar...
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: (Scratches head)
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: (Looks around)
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: (Clears throat awkwardly)
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Spot, are you sick?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: He's certainly not sick.
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: But Spot looks like he's not feeling well...
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Words he hasn't spoken in his entire life are brewing in his mind right now. They're words so corny—
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: —Are you sure about that, Midnight?
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: —No, words of admiration. They are embarrassing to say to someone for the first time, you see.
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: Even I, cunning though I am, found myself terribly flustered when I hosted my first customer.
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: I'm right, aren't I, Spot?
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: What do you say to a little one-on-one sparring tomorrow?
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Haha, it'd be my pleasure.
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: Okay, let me finish what I was about to say—
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: —It's all thanks to Popukar that I realized...
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: (Quietly) ...It might just be easier to tell the people I trust most about my ridiculous 'heroics' than keeping them a secret.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: I see. So Spot is saying we're the ones he trusts the most.
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: Spot, if you want to sock him, I'm willing to look the other way.
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: Orchid—
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: Whatever.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Him spelling it out is as stomach-churning as ever, but seeing as he's not wrong... Whatever.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: That's more like it.
attributes.name: Catapult

attributes.content: Alright, I propose a toast to Spot for the story he told us today. Na zdrowie!
attributes.name: Catapult

attributes.content: Cheers!
attributes.name: Team A6 Members

attributes.content: Alright, enough about my fake hero story—
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: But you are a hero!
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: You blocked Instructor Dobermann for me and protected everyone. You're why we're having this party now. You're a hero!
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: I'm going to hold a medal ceremony for you!
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Team A6 Members

attributes.content: We're all gonna be at the ceremony. Me, Orchid, Catapult, Midnight...
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Hmm... That's not enough!
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Let me think—Um, Bubble!
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Say, Popukar?
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: And Shamare, Suzuran...
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Orchid, Catapult, help me out here. I've got a feeling we have a tough fight on our hands.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: What about me, then?
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: I'm thinking of telling the kitchen you're the one who talked her into this idea.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: You're welcome to go back to the dorm and mourn your paycheck, though.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Who is it?
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: It's me. I have something for you.
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: Here. A 'hero certificate' from Popukar.
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: A what?
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Didn't we spend hours talking Popukar out of the silly ceremony idea?
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: That we did, but she had a new idea when she got back to her room. No one could stop her this time.
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: In any case, here's her hand-drawn hero certificate. For you.
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: And you should know she asked all of us to sign it.
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: And you did?
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Naturally.
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: Yours is the only signature we need now. As soon as you sign it, your appointment as Team A6's hero will be unanimous.
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: Spot doesn't answer him.
He holds in his hands the 'hero certificate.' On it are the most congratulatory of words that Popukar could muster, adorned with a bunch of childish-looking art and decorative borders.
Spot reads the citation text once. Then, he finds his four teammates' signatures at the bottom of the awfully heavy-feeling sheet of paper.
It warms his heart.
What's wrong? Do you need me to lend you an exquisite fountain pen to add the appropriate gravitas to your outstanding signature?
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: No thanks.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Spot doesn't sign the certificate. Instead, he takes out an elegant photo frame and puts the 'hero certificate' inside.
Then, he puts the frame on the most conspicuous part of his nightstand.
Now that won't do, Spot. Popukar will make a huge fuss if you don't sign it.
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: You aren't worried about Popukar. You're just worried Orchid will come complaining if Popukar makes a fuss about it.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Excellent insight!
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: I don't need your accolades. I'm not signing this.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: This is who I am, this is the life for me. I'm no hero.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: What? Not gonna say anything?
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: I'm simply overwhelmed that I finally managed to melt that ice-cold heart of yours with my earnest feelings—
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: Midnight, I've had a sudden change of heart. Maybe it's not so hard to be a hero.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Midnight

attributes.content: The next time I go on a mission with you, I'll make sure there's a bad-tempered girl there for you to flirt with.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: You'll get your ass whooped so bad, you'll end up in Medical for weeks. Then, I'll really be A6's hero.
attributes.name: Spot

attributes.content: The two share a laugh.
